conflictDescription: User Story A requires quick access to patient data in emergencies, but User Story B wants full control over data and app installation even if users do not want to share or install apps, which forbids easy access under some user settings. This creates opposite expectations on data access.
userStoryASummary: As a nurse, I want to access patient data quickly in emergencies, so I can support care efficiently while respecting privacy.
userStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to control app installation and manage user data fully, even if users do not want to share or install apps.
resolutionDescription: Apply a context-aware policy that allows quick access to patient data in emergencies while respecting strict user consent and app installation controls in normal conditions.
newUserStoryASummary: As a nurse, I want to access patient data quickly in emergencies, so I can support care efficiently while respecting privacy and user consent.
newUserStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to control app installation and manage user data fully, ensuring user consent is respected except in emergency situations.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires discussing care adjustments without involving the patient, which implies sharing information with the informal caregiver. User Story B forbids app installation and user data sharing if users do not want it, which can block sharing needed for the discussion. These opposite actions about sharing information cause a Start-Forbid conflict.
userStoryASummary: As a registered nurse, I want to discuss care adjustments with the informal caregiver without involving the patient, so I can keep clinical safety and avoid distractions.
userStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to control app installation and manage user data fully, even if users do not want to share or install apps.
resolutionDescription: The conflict is a Start-Forbid type because one story requires sharing info without patient knowledge, and the other forbids data sharing without user consent. Both stories are updated to require user consent for sharing care adjustments with informal caregivers, balancing privacy and clinical needs.
newUserStoryASummary: As a registered nurse, I want to discuss care adjustments with the informal caregiver after user consent, so I can ensure clinical safety and respect privacy.
newUserStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to control app installation and user data sharing only with user consent, to protect privacy and trust.

conflictDescription: The nurse wants quick and uninterrupted access to the clinical dashboard, but the developer wants full control over app installation and data management even if users refuse sharing or installing apps. This creates opposite expectations on system behavior regarding access and control under the same conditions.
userStoryASummary: As a registered nurse, I want to access my patientâ€™s clinical dashboard quickly during work hours without distractions, so I can focus on essential health data efficiently.
userStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to control app installation and manage user data fully, even if users do not want to share or install apps.
resolutionDescription: Both user stories are updated to balance quick nurse access with developer control by introducing role-based permissions and user consent management to avoid contradiction.
newUserStoryASummary: As a nurse, I want quick access to the clinical dashboard during work hours, so I can focus on patient care efficiently.
newUserStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to manage app installation and data control with respect to user consent and role permissions.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires quick access to patient data with permission, while User Story B wants full control over user data even if users do not want to share or install apps. This means User Story B forbids sharing data that User Story A needs to access, creating a contradiction.
userStoryASummary: As a registered nurse, I want to access my patient's activity and nutrition data quickly with proper permission to monitor health during busy shifts.
userStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to control app installation and manage user data fully, even if users do not want to share or install apps.
resolutionDescription: The resolution balances quick access to patient data with strict user data control by updating both stories to include permission management and user consent, ensuring data sharing only occurs with clear authorization.
newUserStoryASummary: As a nurse, I want quick access to patient data with user consent to monitor health effectively during busy shifts.
newUserStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to manage app installation and control user data sharing based on explicit user permission to protect privacy.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires ALFRED to encourage and adapt exercises for users, which needs the system to operate actively on user data and app functions. User Story B wants developers to manage apps and data fully even if users do not share or install apps, which forbids respecting user privacy settings. These are opposite demands about control and operation on user data and app management.
userStoryASummary: As a registered nurse, I want ALFRED to encourage challenging exercises while adapting difficulty to users' abilities, so I can support progress safely.
userStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to control app installation and manage user data fully, even if users do not want to share or install apps.
resolutionDescription: Both stories are updated to respect user privacy while enabling adaptive exercise encouragement and developer app management under user consent.
newUserStoryASummary: As a registered nurse, I want ALFRED to encourage adaptive exercises while respecting user privacy, so I can support safe progress.
newUserStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to manage apps and user data only with user consent, so that privacy settings are respected.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires video check-ins to focus only on medical issues, forbidding distractions, while User Story B wants full control over app installation and user data management even if users do not want to share or install apps, which conflicts with respecting user privacy and consent.
userStoryASummary: As a registered nurse, I want video check-ins to be only about medical issues to avoid distractions and focus on health.
userStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to control app installation and manage user data fully, even if users do not want to share or install apps.
resolutionDescription: Both user stories are updated to respect user privacy and consent while ensuring video check-ins focus on medical issues and developers manage apps with user permission.
newUserStoryASummary: As a nurse, I want video check-ins to focus on medical issues only, so users are not distracted during health sessions.
newUserStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to manage app installation and user data only with users' consent, so their privacy is respected.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires controlling what health data is shared to protect privacy, implying some data may not be shared. User Story B requires full control over app installation and user data management even if users do not want to share or install apps, which conflicts with respecting user privacy and consent. This is a forbid-stop conflict because one forbids data sharing without consent while the other mandates full data access regardless of user wishes.
userStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to see health data of my clients in one place and control what information is shared to protect their privacy.
userStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to control app installation and manage user data fully, even if users do not want to share or install apps.
resolutionDescription: Both stories are updated to respect user privacy and consent while allowing controlled app installation and data sharing with user permission.
newUserStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to see shared health data with user consent, so that privacy is protected.
newUserStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to manage app installation and data only with user permission, so that privacy and consent are respected.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires that logging of vital signs is controlled with patient consent to protect privacy, while User Story B wants full control over app installation and data management even if users refuse to share data or install apps. These impose opposite system behaviors about respecting user consent.
userStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to control logging of essential vital signs with consent, so that patient privacy is protected.
userStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to control app installation and manage user data fully, even if users do not want to share or install apps.
generalResolutionType: 2. Update one and keep one remain the same
resolutionDescription: Update the developer user story to respect user consent for data sharing and app installation while keeping the caregiver's user story unchanged, ensuring privacy is protected without removing developer control.
newUserStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to control logging of essential vital signs with consent, so that patient privacy is protected.
newUserStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to manage app installation and user data only with user consent, so that privacy and control are balanced.

conflictDescription: The caregiver wants to filter alerts to focus on urgent cases, which implies the system processes and displays alert data, while the developer wants full control over app installation and user data even if users do not want to share or install apps, potentially forbidding sharing or filtering user data. This creates a conflict because the caregiver's need to access and filter alert data is forbidden by the developer's control over restricting app and data sharing.
userStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to filter alerts by priority so I can quickly focus on urgent cases and manage multiple clients clearly.
userStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to control app installation and manage user data fully, even if users do not want to share or install apps.
resolutionDescription: Adjust both user stories to balance caregiver alert filtering needs with developer control over app installation and data sharing, allowing alert filtering only with user consent and controlled data access.
newUserStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to filter alerts by priority when permitted, so I can focus on urgent cases and manage clients effectively.
newUserStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to control app installation and data sharing respecting user consent, so the system stays secure and user privacy is protected.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires the system to respect client privacy by only showing health data allowed by the client, while User Story B wants the developer to have full control over app installation and user data even if users do not want to share or install apps. These instructions oppose each other on handling user data privacy.
userStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to see only the health data clients allow me to see, so I respect their privacy and keep their trust.
userStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to control app installation and manage user data fully, even if users do not want to share or install apps.
resolutionDescription: Modify both stories to respect user privacy as a priority while allowing developers controlled app management within consented boundaries.
newUserStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to see only the health data clients allow me to see, so I respect their privacy and keep their trust.
newUserStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to manage app installation and user data only with user consent, to ensure privacy and system integrity.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires using video calls for guided exercises, which needs app installation and data sharing, while User Story B forbids app installation and data sharing if users do not want it. This creates a conflict where one story wants the operation to happen when needed, but the other forbids it in all cases.
userStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to use video calls for guided exercises with my clients so I can connect with them and support their activity.
userStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to control app installation and manage user data fully, even if users do not want to share or install apps.
resolutionDescription: Both user stories are updated to balance user consent and functionality. The caregiver story includes video calls only when users agree to app installation and data sharing. The developer story respects user consent and manages apps and data accordingly.
newUserStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to use video calls for guided exercises only when users agree to install apps and share data, so I can support their activity.
newUserStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to manage app installation and user data with respect to users' consent, so that privacy is protected.

conflictDescription: User Story A wants to stop automatic sharing of private data except in emergencies, while User Story B wants to fully control app installation and user data even if users do not want to share or install apps. These are opposite expectations on data sharing and control.
userStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to stop automatic sharing of my clients' private data except in emergencies, to keep their trust and privacy safe.
userStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to control app installation and manage user data fully, even if users do not want to share or install apps.
resolutionDescription: Both user stories are updated to balance privacy protection with developer control by allowing emergency data sharing and controlled app installation with user consent and safety checks.
newUserStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to stop automatic sharing of private data except during emergencies, to protect privacy and trust.
newUserStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to manage app installation and user data with user consent and emergency exceptions, to ensure safety and compliance.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires ALFRED to respect users' wishes for less guidance and easier options, implying less intervention. User Story B requires developers to control app installation and manage user data fully, even if users do not want it, which contradicts respecting user preferences.
userStoryASummary: As a caregiver, I want ALFRED to respect users' wishes for less guidance and easier options, so they feel independent and not frustrated.
userStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to control app installation and manage user data fully, even if users do not want to share or install apps.
resolutionDescription: We update both stories to balance user independence with necessary developer control, allowing user preferences to guide intervention while enabling developers to manage critical app installation and data within consent and privacy rules.
newUserStoryASummary: As a caregiver, I want ALFRED to respect users' wishes for less guidance and easier options, so they feel independent and comfortable.
newUserStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to manage app installation and user data with user consent, ensuring control while respecting privacy and preferences.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires respecting clients' choices about data sharing, implying not forcing data sharing. User Story B requires developers to control data fully even if users do not want to share or install apps, which forbids respecting user refusal. These are strict opposite requirements that cannot be satisfied at the same time.
userStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to explain data sharing to clients clearly and respect their choices, so they feel safe and in control.
userStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to control app installation and manage user data fully, even if users do not want to share or install apps.
resolutionDescription: Both user stories are updated to balance user control over data sharing with developer management needs, enabling controlled data handling respecting user consent.
newUserStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to explain data sharing clearly and respect clients' choices, so they feel safe and control their data sharing.
newUserStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to manage app installation and data access within user consent, so system integrity and privacy are maintained.

conflictDescription: User Story A wants ALFRED to support clients with activities they enjoy, which may include installing apps and sharing data, while User Story B wants developers to fully control app installation and user data even if users do not want to share or install apps. This means one requires allowing user participation, the other forbids user choice, causing opposite system behaviors on app installation and data sharing.
userStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want ALFRED to support clients with activities they enjoy, including easy options, so they stay happy and involved.
userStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to control app installation and manage user data fully, even if users do not want to share or install apps.
resolutionDescription: We update both stories to balance user participation and developer control by allowing user-friendly app installation with developer oversight and respecting user privacy preferences.
newUserStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want ALFRED to support clients with easy activity options, including approved app installations, so they stay happy and involved.
newUserStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to manage app installation and user data with controls that respect user consent and privacy.

conflictDescription: User Story A wants to allow caregivers to choose what sensor data and notifications to share, respecting user privacy. User Story B wants developers to control app installation and manage user data fully, even if users do not want to share data or install apps. These are opposite expectations about data sharing and user control.
userStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to choose what sensor data and notifications to share for each client, so I respect their privacy and keep care personal.
userStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to control app installation and manage user data fully, even if users do not want to share or install apps.
resolutionDescription: Both user stories are updated to balance user privacy control and developer management rights by defining clear boundaries and contexts for data sharing and app installation.
newUserStoryASummary: As a caregiver, I want to select sensor data to share with permission, so that user privacy is respected and care stays personal.
newUserStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to manage app installation and data within user consent and privacy rules, so apps work safely and properly.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires ALFRED to prepare personalized exercise plans respecting privacy, meaning user data should be protected and shared only with consent. User Story B requires developers to control app installation and manage user data fully, even if users do not want to share data or install apps. These are opposite expectations about user privacy and data use.
userStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want ALFRED to prepare exercise plans that respect personal needs and privacy, so users feel comfortable and motivated.
userStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to control app installation and manage user data fully, even if users do not want to share or install apps.
resolutionDescription: Both user stories are updated to balance user privacy with developer control by enforcing user consent for data sharing and app installation management within ALFRED's secure framework.
newUserStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want ALFRED to prepare exercise plans respecting privacy and user consent, so users feel safe and motivated.
newUserStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to manage app installation and user data only with user consent, so ALFRED stays secure and respects privacy.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires the system to respect user privacy and share data only with clear permission, while User Story B requires the developer to have full control over app installation and user data even without user consent. These are opposite expectations about controlling data and app installation.
userStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to check clients' privacy settings to respect their choices and share data only with clear permission.
userStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to control app installation and manage user data fully, even if users do not want to share or install apps.
resolutionDescription: Adjust both stories to balance user privacy with developer control, requiring explicit user consent for data sharing and app installation, except in emergency or maintenance contexts.
newUserStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to check clients' privacy settings and share data only with their clear permission to respect their choices.
newUserStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to control app installation and manage user data only with user consent, except in emergency or maintenance situations.
